thread.title: Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo left out of Man City line up against Bournemouth
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo left out of Man City line up against Bournemouth

author: James Robson
title: Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo left out of Man City line up against Bournemouth
text:
Sport Sergio Aguero and Claudio Bravo left out of Man City line up against Bournemouth Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has stuck with his front three of Gabriel Jesus, Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Pep on Aguero not getting games Share this video Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Pep Guardiola has dropped Sergio Aguero for the third game running, with the Argentine striker starting on the bench for tonight's game against Bournemouth . 
Manchester City's manager has stuck with the front three of Gabriel Jesus, Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling. 
Both Guardiola and City insist they want Aguero to stay - but another game on the sidelines will only add to the uncertainty over his future. 
Ahead of the game Guardiola urged City's leading scorer to 'remind me how good you are' - but he will have to do from the bench at the Goldsands Stadium. 
Asked if Aguero would stay beyond the summer, Guardiola said: “At the end of the season I don’t know. 
“I know how difficult it is to find top goalscorers. 
“I would like him to stay, but I don’t know what is going to happen. 
“Even in my career I didn’t know what would happen at the end of the season. 
“Sergio knows the intention of his manager and the club. I don’t want to sell him, I want him to stay here for a long time until he decides.” 
Explaining his decision to name an unchanged forward line, Guardiola told Sky Sports: "They did really well in the last three games. The first pressure is so intensive. 
"They attack a lot with runs behind and they have the quality in front of goal." 
Claudio Bravo also remains on the bench with Willy Caballero starting in goal. 
Bacary Sagna could line up at centre back aget bing named ahead of Vincent Kompany in the starting XI. Read More
